captions.text: everyone wants things to go their way
here seven mine tricks you can do right now to get what you want
to get someone to subconsciously
think be like you mirror their body language "feel like we could
bring in" "that's great I'd love to work here"
ask a small favor of someone. "Can you open this for me"
before you ask them for what you really want "hey you know you're pretty strong"
"I'm moving this weekend I could really use some help"
"Oh, yeah sure"
ask for something big "Hey Sarah would you mind watching my cat this weekend?"
"uh this weekend?" before you reveal what you really need
"Actually maybe that's a lot to ask, maybe just put this mail for me"
"Yea, I could do that" sometimes we think our emotions are caused one reason
but are actually caused by another
do something exciting with the day and they might mistake there jitters for
attraction
you can get someone to agree with you in the moment on something that is clearly
incorrect
by placing them in a group setting and having everyone else give that wrong
answer
"Hey, by the way all of us have been showing up to work every Sunday"
"You haven't been there, right guys?" "every Sunday man" "you got a show up to work on Sunday man"
"okay okay"
"cool" if you want someone to remember you out of the group, try to be introduced first
or last
"Who wants to go first?" "I'll go first" "we all have to go to the damn bathroom every once in a
"while but what could be a helluva lot more"
fun" you do you can persuade an audience better by mildly swearing at the
start and/or end of a speech or presentation
it will demonstrate that you're passionate about your argument "and short"
"it's something we need, damn it"
*Applause*

title: Mind Tricks To Get What You Want

comments.text:
The "Foot in the Door" technique doesn't really work. You wouldnt ask 
someone for a favor and then directly ask them for a bigger favor. It gives 
the impression of being needy. The only reason it seemed to make sense here 
is because you followed the first favor up with a compliment. The better 
thing to do is to wait until a person needs a small favor from you, or wait 
until they do something worth complimenting then simply, compliment them.﻿

comments.text:
"To get someone to subconsciously think you like them, mirror their body 
language" - Deception and fakery
" you can get someone to agree with you in the moment on something that is 
clearly incorrect by placing them in a group setting and having everyone 
else giving that wrong answer" - Deception fakery and manipulation

So in summery the advice here is that to get what YOU want you have to be 
willing to deceive people, lie to them, manipulate them and a situation, 
and swear? really?, 
I know this is the behaviour and mentality of business needing to seek 
profits and it has rotted the minds of people for centuries but its just so 
fake and deceiving.
IF you want to get what you want then be genuine, its the only way you can 
be sure that you're being real and avoids the inevitable clash and conflict 
later on when the other people find out that you are just completely full 
of bullshit at the highest degree and not to be trusted.﻿
comments.author: Jimmy James

comments.text:
These tactics primarily work on Nero typical's, or people whose brain I 
wired in a predictable typical way.

Suggestion, hypnotism, and many of these techniques do not work very well 
on Savants, Aspies & autistics ppl, some ppl with brain injury, and such. 
Additionally, SP savants and people like that will not be able to 
successfully do half of these techniques such as Mirroring.

If and when they do try to mirror someone, it will be so obvious and 
insulting, it will basely backfire in their face.
comments.author: Imeh Smith

comments.text:
+Shabit Hassan

"To get someone to subconsciously think you like them, mirror their body 
language" - Do you copy someone's body language naturally? Most people do 
not so this is not being real/yourself, therefore it can be classed as 
being fake.

" you can get someone to agree with you in the moment on something that is 
clearly incorrect by placing them in a group setting and having everyone 
else giving that wrong answer" - Other than doing this for a laugh, it is 
deceiving and i clearly dont need to explain why. All of the above are 
forms of manipulating the subconscious in the same why that marketing does, 
Though this is business as usual and common place today, it serves to 
benefit the individual by taking advantage of others and in my experience 
this always has repercussions if the individual is looking to build strong 
relationships with people. If you dont step in bullshit the first time 
you're bound to smell it later on.
comments.author: Jimmy James

letting me know how you feel, it brightened up my day tremendously.
